The Standard file reader¶

class fstpy.std_reader.StandardFileReader(filenames, decode_metadata=False, load_data=False, subset=None, array_container='numpy')¶

Class to handle fst files Opens, reads the contents of an fst files or files into a pandas Dataframe and closes No data is loaded unless specified, only the metadata is read. Extra metadata is added to the dataframe if specified.

Parameters

  • filenames (str|list[str]) – path to file or list of paths to files

  • decode_metadata (bool, optional) – adds extra columns, defaults to False ‘unit’:str, unit name |br| ‘unit_converted’:bool |br| ‘description’:str, field description |br| ‘date_of_observation’:datetime, of the date of observation |br| ‘date_of_validity’:datetime, of the date of validity |br| ‘level’:float32, decoded ip1 level |br| ‘ip1_kind’:int32, decoded ip1 kind |br| ‘ip1_pkind’:str, string repr of ip1_kind int |br| ‘data_type_str’:str, string repr of data type |br| ‘label’:str, label derived from etiket |br| ‘run’:str, run derived from etiket |br| ‘implementation’:str, implementation derived from etiket |br| ‘ensemble_member’:str, ensemble member derived from etiket |br| ‘surface’:bool, True if the level is a surface level |br| ‘follow_topography’:bool, indicates if this type of level follows topography |br| ‘vctype’:str, vertical level type |br| ‘forecast_hour’:timedelta, forecast hour decoded from ip2 |br| ‘ip2_dec’:value of decoded ip2 |br| ‘ip2_kind’:kind of decoded ip2 |br| ‘ip2_pkind’:printable kind of decoded ip2 |br| ‘ip3_dec’:value of decoded ip3 |br| ‘ip3_kind’:kind of decoded ip3 |br| ‘ip3_pkind’:printable kind of decoded ip3 |br|

  • load_data (bool, optional) – if True, the data will be read, not just the metadata (fstluk vs fstprm), default False

  • subset (dict, optional) – parameter to pass to fstinl to select specific records (https://wiki.cmc.ec.gc.ca/wiki/Python-RPN/2.0/rpnpy/librmn/fstd98#fstinl)

  • array_container (str) – specifies the type of arrays that data is contained in, default ‘numpy’, can be set to ‘dask.array’

to_pandas()¶

creates the dataframe from the provided file metadata

Returns

df

Return type

pd.Dataframe

to_xarray(timeseries=False, attributes=False)¶

creates a xarray from the provided data

Parameters

  • timeseries (bool, optional) – if True, organizes the xarray into a time series, defaults to False

  • attributes (bool, optional) – if True, will add attributes to the data arrays, defaults to False

Returns

xarray containing contents of cmc standard files

Return type

xarray.DataSet

fstpy.std_reader.load_data(df)¶

Gets the associated data for every record in a dataframe

Parameters

df (pd.DataFrame) – dataframe to fill

Returns

filled dataframe

Return type

pd.DataFrame
